title: Expenses and benefits: company vans and fuel

details.description: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing company vans and fuel
details.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for company vans and fuel

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
As an employer providing company vans and fuel to your employees, you have certain National Insurance and reporting obligations.

What’s included

This includes any van used for:

  • business journeys
  • commuting
  • private journeys

parts.title: What's exempt
parts.body:
You don’t have to report or pay anything to HMRC if your van is used in one of the ways listed below.

Business journeys and commuting

A business journey is a trip:

  • made as part of work (eg a service engineer travelling between appointments)
  • to a temporary workplace

Vans used for ‘insignificant’ private journeys are exempt, eg making a slight detour to pick up a newspaper on the way to work.

Private journeys

Vans and fuel used for private journeys are exempt if your employee earns at a rate of less than £8,500 a year.

Pool vans

You won’t need to report your van if it’s all of the following:

  • available for use and used by more than 1 employee
  • available to each employee because they need it to do their job
  • not ordinarily used by 1 employee to the exclusion of others
  • not normally kept at or near employees’ homes
  • used only for business journeys – limited private use is allowed, but only if it’s incidental to a business journey, eg driving home to allow an early start the next morning

parts.title: What to report and pay
parts.body:
If your van isn’t exempt, you must report it to HMRC and pay National Insurance on it.

Vans used for private journeys

Who gets the benefit What to do What to deduct or pay
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year Report on form P11D, section G Class 1A National Insurance on the value of the benefit
Directors Report on form P11D, section G Class 1A National Insurance on the value of the benefit

parts.title: Work out the value
parts.body:
Vans used for private journeys

There’s a standard value of £3,000 that you’ll need to report. This can be reduced if:

  • your employee can’t use the van for 30 days in a row
  • your employee pays you to privately use the van
  • other employees use the van - divide £3,000 by the number of employees

Van fuel for private journeys

There’s a standard value of £550 that you’ll need to report. This can be reduced if:

  • the employee can’t use the van for 30 days in a row
  • your employee pays you back for all their private fuel
  • you stopped providing fuel during the tax year

Calculating your reductions

Most payroll software packages will work the reductions out for you.

You can also use HMRC’s Online Return and Forms PAYE service.
